post_text: Job well done by our first responders including K-9 Connor!
shared_text:
South Kingstown Police Department
August 31 at 9:13 AM ·

K-9 Unit in Action

At approximately 10:40 pm the South Kingstown Police department received a call for a missing persons in the area of Ministerial Road and Post Road. Officer Giorgio, Officer McHugh and his K-9 partner Connor responded to the area. The family advised their mother had been missing in the woods for over an hour and was last seen walking northbound looking for their family dog.

Officer McHugh and K-9 Connor along with the assistance of Officer Giorgio started a K-9 track through the woods for approximately a half mile. K-9 Connor began pulling through four (4) foot deep mud, as well as dense branches and thorn bushes. K-9 Connor began barking, at which time Officer’s could hear a female voice approximately thirty feet away. Officer Giorgio remained with the female as further emergency assets were called in to assist. South Kingstown Fire, Police and EMS responded to the area and were able to safely extricate the missing female from the woods who was approximately one hundred (100) yards in from Ministerial Road. Job well done by K-9 Connor!

July 20 at 10:06 AM ·

July 20, 2020

Press Release

It is with deepest sorrow that the East Greenwich Police Department and the Town of East Greenwich announce the passing of Sergeant Christopher Callan. Sergeant Callan passed away on the morning of July 18, 2020 due to injuries sustained in a skydiving accident in Danielson Connecticut. Sergeant Callan was a 15 year veteran of the department and was assigned as the 2nd shift supervisor. Sergeant Callan was an exemplary officer. Sergeant Callan was also a member of the RI National Guard and had an extensive military career including service in the US Army Special Forces “Green Berets”. Sergeant Callan served numerous tours of duty overseas. Sergeant Callan also served as the Jump Master for the RI National Guard’s annual Leapfest competition at URI. Sergeant Callan developed and maintained an extensive network of friends and colleagues worldwide due to his military and police service. Sergeant Callan is survived by his 3 children, mother, father and two sisters. Sergeant Callan will be sorely missed.

Rhode Island State Police
May 15 at 10:30 AM ·

Unfortunately, we have received numerous reports of suspected fraud related to unemployment insurance (UI) benefits claims. If you have received a notice from the Rhode Island Department of Labor and Training (DLT) indicating that a UI claim was filed in your name — and you did not file a claim — please visit our website to file a report https://risp.ri.gov/fcu/FUICI.php. If you have already made a report directly to DLT or to your local police department, your report is logged and you do not need to make an additional report with us.

If you have been notified that your direct deposit bank account for your UI benefit has been changed to another account, please email DLT at DLT.investigations@dlt.ri.gov.

As a result of the suspected fraud, many existing UI benefits may have been stopped. If you have stopped receiving UI benefits, please contact DLT at 401-243-9100.

Thank you for your cooperation. #AlwaysThere

May 5 at 4:37 PM ·

I’ll be signing an executive order directing everyone in a public place – whether indoors or outdoors – to wear a cloth face covering. The exceptions are for young kids and anyone whose health would be damaged by wearing a face covering. The order goes into effect Friday.

It's no secret that art can be a source of comfort, strength, and hope in difficult times. That’s something I think all Rhode Islanders need right now. So today, I’m announcing an initiative for all Rhode Islanders to connect through art during this difficult time. I'm inviting Rhode Islanders of all ages to create and share family-friendly art - drawings, poetry, songs, essays, photographs, videos, or any preferred medium - inspired by this unique & challenging time. Rhode Islanders can share artwork by posting it on social media with the tag #RIArts. Creations can also be submitted via email or mail to the Rhode Island State Council on the Arts. We want to see art from everyone – professional artists, students of all ages, and adults of all ages.

We've also launched RIArts.org. If you’re an artist, you can go to this website to connect with resources available to support artists. If you’re someone who is missing the arts, you can go to RIArts.org to get an up-to-date list of all the performances (music, film, theater) going on virtually around the state.

Census statistics help determine the number of seats each state holds in the U.S. House of Representatives and how billions of dollars in federal funds will be allocated by state, local, and federal lawmakers every year for the next 10 years!!

If your household has not yet responded, now is the time! Go to 2020census.gov to respond or for more information about why this is so important for all of us!

*IMPORTANT NOTE FOR COLLEGE STUDENTS: even though many students have returned home due to the current COVID-19 pandemic, please make sure you USE YOUR NORMAL ADDRESS WHERE YOU LIVE WHEN YOU ARE AT SCHOOL. The 2020census.gov website has more detailed information and answers to many other frequently asked questions.

Many people are using more Disinfecting wipes than usual recently, and we wanted to create a bit of awareness around wipes in general. Disinfecting wipes, Baby wipes, even wipes that are actually advertised as “Flushable wipes”... should NOT be flushed. When flushed, wipes cause significant problems at Wastewater Treatment Facilities and in septic systems. We all know, some from experience, that many things can be flushed (little green army guys, matchbox cars, retainers, jewelry...) but shouldn’t be... Please add wipes to this list. Our Wastewater Treatment Facility employees thank you.
#wipesclogpipes

post_text: Spring is on the way! Construction for the Bike Path Connector from Broad Rock Fields to South County Commons is moving along. The approximate one-mile paved path will help to enforce an interconnect between retail/commercial, recreational, and residential zones in the area. At its completion, bike/pedestrian users will be able to travel from Old Mountain Field to South County Commons on a safe, paved route that is almost entirely removed from vehicular traffic.Funding for the project has been in the Town’s Capital Improvement Program since 2007. Additional funding is provided through the Rhode Island Department of Environmental Management grant funding.

During Monday evening’s regular session, the Town Council presented retiring Town Clerk Dale Holberton with a proclamation recognizing her 39+ years of service to the Town, and conferring on her the designation of “Town Clerk Emeritus.”

VFW Post 916 Commander Joe “Tiger” Patrick was also in attendance and presented Dale with a Certificate of Special Recognition from the Veterans of Foreign Wars and a beautiful wooden flag made by a local veteran, in appreciation for her dedicated work with the town’s veterans, as liaison to the Veterans’ Memorial Park Commission over these many years.

We will miss working with her, but are excited for her to begin her next chapter and enjoy her time with family and friends; and as Dale said last night to a room full of community members wishing her well, she will now also have time to work on improving her golf game... we will miss you Dale, thank you for your dedicated service to your community!

post_text: Abcore Restoration recently put the final touches on the Peace Dale (Hazard Memorial) Library’s 129 year old light fixture. Refurbishing the light fixture was part of re-opening the original front entrance of the library for public use. Several pieces of thin wire had to be individually bent and tacked into place and new glass brackets were used to keep the original 1” beveled glass in place. The same epoxy paint Abcore uses when refurbishing lighthouses was used on this light fixture, so it will likely last for another 129 years! Thank you to The Friends of the Peace Dale Library for providing funding for the refurbishment.
